thread.title: Bieber 'faked illness to skip deposition'
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber 'faked illness to skip deposition' | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.com Reporter
title: Bieber 'faked illness to skip deposition'
text:
Lawyers are claiming that Justin Bieber had faked illness to get out of a deposition.
Attorneys say they have video proof that the 22-year-old singer had instead opted for a night of partying according to a Thursday report from TMZ .
Documents obtained by the site showed that there was a scheduled deposition but Bieber's team informed the lawyers he wouldn't be able to make it because he was 'ill' just hours before the meeting.
Scroll down for video
Uh oh: Justin Bieber allegedly faked illness to get out of a deposition as there were videos posted of him partying on the same day according to lawyers in a TMZ report
Apparently the attorneys were not pleased to find that they had found videos on YouTube of the singer enjoying an outing at Bootsy Bellows on the same day of the deposition.
The clips seemingly shared by his fans show Bieber chugging beers before heading to the West Hollywood hotspot.
According to TMZ, the lawyers said they had even traveled from Nashville to Los Angeles just to make it easier for the Canadian crooner to meet.
Her song: The 22-year-old singer is being sued by indie rocker Casey Dienel (pictured in 2011), aka White Hinterland, for allegedly using her vocal riff from her 2014 single Ring The Bell for his hit Sorry
The documents also say that the singer gloated about missing the meeting by being featured in social media posts while drinking with friends just hours after his absence.
The publication says the attorneys are willing to let him redeem himself but this time on their own turf in Nashville sometime early next month.
Last year it was reported by TMZ that he was being sued by indie rocker Casey Dienel, aka White Hinterland, for allegedly taking her riff from her 2014 single Ring The Bell.
The 31-year-old American singer claimed the 'unique characteristics of the female vocal' in her song are exactly what can be heard in Sorry.
Cover art: The Canadian singer recorded Sorry for his fourth studio album, Purpose, and released the track on October 23, 2015
Casey claims that Justin repeated her riff six times in his Sorry track, according to the news site.
That's not the only similarity. According to the Massachusetts-based songwriter, both tracks feature keyboard synthesizers, samples, synth bass, drums and percussion.
However, it may be a stretch proving that one in court as a great many songs use all those instruments in one form or another.
Casey pointed out her Ring The Bell was popular (more than 800,000 streams and counting) and was favorably received by Rolling Stone magazine.
Justin recorded Sorry for his fourth studio album, Purpose, and released the track on October 23, 2015.
Chill: The singer pictured out in Los Angeles back in December
